form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: Medical Certification For Disability Exceptions, N-64/29/2023

full_text: Screened by NARA, 6/29/2023 U. S. Department of Justice OMB # 1115-0205 Immigration and Naturalization Service Medical Cerfication For Disability Expections Part I. THIS SECTION TO BE COMPLETED BY THE APPLICANT (Please print or type information) Last Name First Name Middle Name Social Security Number MATUS MARIA 6 619-05-3689 Address Alien Number 1109 ONEONTA DR. A092360662 City State Zip Code LOS ANGELES CALIFORNIA. 90065 Telephone Number Date of Birth Sex 11-12-14 FEMALE. (213) 258-0838 I, MARIA MATUS. authorize BRUCE TORKAN M.D. (Applicant's Name) (Licensed medical doctor or licensed clinical psychologist) to release all relevant physical and mental health information related to my medical status to the INS for the purpose of applying for an exception from the English language and U.S. civics testing requirements for naturalization. I certify under penalty of perjury pursuant to Title 28 U.S.C. Section 1746, that the information on the form and any evidence submitted with it is all true and correct. I am aware that the knowing placement of false information on the Form N-648 and related documents may also subject me to civil penalties under 8 U.S.C. Section 1324c. Signature 03-06-99 Date Part II. THIS SECTION TO BE COMPLETED BY A LICENSED MEDICAL DOCTOR OR LICENSED CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGIST (see instructions) The individual named above is applying for an exception from the English language and U.S. history and civics tests required of applicants for naturalization. The Immigration and Naturalization Service's regulations require that applicants for an exception based on disability submit this certification form, completed by a licensed medical doctor or licensed clinical psychologist, along with a completed application for naturalization (Form N-400). Please answer the following questions as clearly and completely as possible, using common terminology and complete words and phrases. 03-06-99 1. Date of your most recent examination of the applicant. 19 2. Is this your first examination of the individual? Yes No If yes, who is the regular attending physician? 3. Based on your examination, describe any findings of a physical or mental disability or impairment which, in your professional medical opinion, would prevent this applicant from demonstrating knowledge of basic English language and/or U.S. history and civics. Describe in detail. If applicant has a mental disability or impairment, please provide DSM diagnosis. DIAGNOSIS OF MENTAL DISABILITY OR IMPAIRMENT: 1. Memory impairment due to: A. Dementia of the Alzheimer type with depressed mood DSM IV 290.21 B. Organic brain syndrome ICD code 310.1 PHYSICAL DISABILITY OR IMPAIRMENT. 1. Osteoarthritis lower extremities both joints and lumbar since 1989 ICD code 714 2. Constant cephalgia for one year. ICD code 7840 3. Frequente diarrhea for long time ICD code 0090 4. Hypercholesterolemia since 1997 ICD code 2720. 5. Moderate vision loss bilaterally 20/50 ICD code 36902 6. Varicose veins both legs for I5 year ICD code 369.02 7. Osteoporosis unknown date of onset, ICD code 733 8. Moderate hearing loss both ears since 1993 ICD code 389 9. Left and right cataract since 1993 ICD code 366.13 10 Hysterectomy (1995) 11. Dizziness for 3 years. Osteoarthritis of lumbar vertebral and lower extremities joints limit the patien patient's ability toattend classes. Dementia and her multiple physical disabilities make her unable to learn new concepts Therefore, I recommend to waive Civics and English tests for her. to Form N-648 (06/24/97) Page 3 Please see the attached report.
